intro: Euryops dregeanus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow or orange ray flowers and dense, dark green foliage. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Euryops dregeanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
